reviewTitle: Well Built, Value for Money Quality Product
reviewDescription: I recently purchased the Tribit StormBox 2 Bluetooth Speaker, and it has exceeded my expectations in several ways. Here's my detailed review:Pros:- Impressive Sound Quality:- The sound output is rich, clear, and well-balanced. The bass is punchy without overpowering the mids and highs, making it perfect for all genres of music.-  Durable Build:  The speaker feels sturdy and well-made.- Long Battery Life:  The 20-hour battery life is fantastic for extended use,charging time is 4hrs- The Bluetooth 5.3 connection is stable and offers excellent range. Pairing was quick and hassle-free.Cons:- Bass Boost Could Be Better, better to use it till 80%Overall Impression:The Tribit StormBox 2 offers great value for its price. It‚Äôs a versatile, reliable Bluetooth speaker that delivers excellent sound quality . Since I have used for just 1 week will update after some time for durability Got it for around 4.5K during some offer.

    ¬†Tribit Strom box upgraded one reviewThis was speaker I was looking for alternative to JBL flip 6 as it is costly and if i didn't spend that muchI never got clear audio from any speaker I brought potronics it satisfies loudness but doesn't have clarity,got to search again, I got Bose but it was best audio I have every heard but not affordable for me,JBL was some what clear and it to goes above 9k so next I got recommended by this speaker by my friend and the quality is as par as JBL flip but it have proper mids in tuning app you have to spend time to adjust,Comming to portable it was good it fits my dell laptop side bag, the greatest advantage is connectivity really it connects till 70 meters in football ground without any disturbance even tough I was in between mobile and speaker beyond that It connect till 100 meters if no disturbance in between like hurdle between them Commig to battery it comes 5 hours full sound and lesser or 60-70 it comes more than 8-9 hours and 50 percent volume more than thatIn practical 50 percent volume is enough inside home and you will feel clarityOn outside or bike it need 70 volume and everyone observes you, in such conditions this tribit Strom box is value for moneyOver all value for money for everything

The Tribit StormBox 2 has completely exceeded my expectations in every way, especially with its 34W 360¬∞ surround sound and XBass technology. If you‚Äôre on the hunt for a Bluetooth speaker that delivers powerful audio and deep bass, this one should be at the top of your list.Sound Quality and BassThe sound quality of the StormBox 2 is phenomenal. It fills the room with crisp, balanced audio that‚Äôs immersive from every angle. What truly stands out is the XBass feature‚Äîthe bass is incredibly punchy and satisfying without overpowering the other frequencies. Whether you‚Äôre streaming your favorite playlist or watching a movie, the audio feels rich and dynamic.360¬∞ Surround SoundThe 360¬∞ surround sound is not just a gimmick; it genuinely enhances the listening experience. No matter where you are in the room, the sound remains consistent, making it perfect for parties, outdoor gatherings, or just lounging at home.Build and PortabilityTribit has nailed the design with a rugged, water-resistant build (IP67-rated), making it perfect for outdoor use. It‚Äôs compact and easy to carry, but it doesn‚Äôt compromise on durability. I‚Äôve used it at the beach and during a hike, and it held up beautifully.Battery Life and ConnectivityThe battery life is stellar, lasting up to 20 hours on a single charge, even at higher volumes. Pairing via Bluetooth is seamless, and the connection remains stable over a long range.Value for MoneyAt its price point, the StormBox 2 is a steal. It combines premium sound quality, robust build, and practical features, making it a versatile and reliable option for any occasion.Final ThoughtsThe Tribit StormBox 2 is hands-down one of the best Bluetooth speakers in its category. Its impressive bass, 360¬∞ sound, and portable design make it a must-have for audiophiles and casual listeners alike. I can‚Äôt recommend it enough‚Äîthis speaker truly punches above its weight in performance and value

Big mistake.- Stormbox 2 had 200ms - 250ms of audio lag. This means that I can‚Äôt watch movies with it as dialogues won‚Äôt match.- Also, when I use it with my MacBook the speaker produces choppy audio sometime as if the signals are breaking.- It has a cheap chinese DAC that is not HiRes.- Can‚Äôt produce good quality audio at high volume. Only good at 75% volume which is about 25Watt output (so 35W is useless)I should have rather bought soundcore motion 100 which has better DAC and has HiRes with low latency codec support. And is cheaper than this also.

reviewTitle: Finally... What I was looking for....
reviewDescription: From past  4 years I am using JBL Clip 3 and really love it.. So finally decided to get a new Portable Speaker.My basic Criteria was Portable,Clear Audio,Hands free Calling good battery backup water dust resist...As JBL dosent support Hands free calling and double the price so i went for StormBox 2.Pros:Built :10/10 (Really good built and feels premium good button clicks)Audio 9/10 (Dont expect thumping Bass as jbl but the best part is tribit App Custom EQ which makes huge difference )Loudness 10/10 (good enough for its size)Calling 9/10 (Clear)Bluetooth Connectivity 10/10 (Using with iphone 15pro max no issue yet)Battery: As the speaker is new ill update battery performence soon once the battery cycle gets stable.Cons:Nothing as such as the product is new but ill keep updating the experience.Final conclusion:You will love it if you don't compare...The only concern I have is after sales once the product is out of warranty coz JBL has a good service network in india even if the product is out of warranty(paid)....

reviewTitle: BÃ∂aÃ∂sÃ∂sÃ∂ iÃ∂sÃ∂ lÃ∂aÃ∂cÃ∂kÃ∂iÃ∂nÃ∂gÃ∂ [Updated Review - 5 star now]
reviewDescription:
The media could not be loaded.
                
            
                
            
        
    
    








  
  
    ¬†I'm updating my review because I have been waiting for the return pick up and used the speakers a little more. It turns out, I needed to burn in the speakers. After listening to a lot of music and playing a 54Hz sine wave sound, the speakers have opened up a bit, as in the passive bass radiators have become a little looser/softer so the speakers are producing more bass.I took my speaker to a croma store and compared it to a JBL flip 6, 34W of the tribit vs 30W of the JBL. 4W might seem like a small difference but I could tell the difference in the loudness between the two speakers. The Tribit is noticeably louder. The JBL has a little more bass but what Tribit has done is simply amazing.It costs half as much as the Flip 6 but nothing will make you feel like it's the cheaper product.Pros:- Solid build quality, premium fabric finish and the plastic parts and buttons are also really good to the touch- Distortion free audio. This is the cherry on the top. Even at 100% volume and with a bass heavy equalizer, the sound does not distort. I am no expert but the speaker has some kind of in built processing to suppress the bass at higher volumes if it feels that might introduce distortion.- The speaker is very portable. This is true for the JBL Flip 6 as well. The built in lanyard is useful to hang it and the curved square shape means that it can lie flat on all 4 sides unlike the JBL which is flat only from one side.- 360¬∞ sound. There are drivers on both sides. The Flip 6 has drivers only on one side- The sound quality is very good and premium feeling. It can make you feel like you made it in life because you were able to buy this speaker.- Underrated feature but this speaker supports both TWS and Party Mode. TWS means one speaker acts as the left channel and the other as the right channel. Party mode means both speakers play the same sound to double the loudness. Here is a tip, put one speaker on each side of your head and watch a movie. It feels like you're in a theatre. The fact that you can buy 2 Tribit Stormbox 2s for the price of 1 JBL flip is a complete game changer. The Flip 6 does not stand a chance in front of 2 Stormbox 2s in TWS or party mode- The Tribit speaker has an in built mic so you can answer calls and use google now/siri/chatgpt with the Stormbox 2. The JBL Flip 6 does not have a mic so no voice features- If two speakers are connects in TWS/Party Mode and you turn one off, the other one turns off automatically. How convenient!- It has an AUX input. The Flip 6 does notCons:- Bass is not as much as the Flip 6 but is still very decentI'll update my review again if I find more consFinal verdict:Buy it and you won't be disappointed. Movie watching, music listening, gameplay all are amazing with this speaker

reviewTitle: Fantastic Bluetooth speaket to listen to Music and Audiobooks
reviewDescription: Why is Tribit StormBox 2 one of the Best Bluetooth Speakers to listen to Music and Audiobooks:To listen effectively to Music/Audiobook we need quality bluetooth speakers like Tribit Stormbox 2. Once this device is connected to our mobile Bluetooth, the quality of the sound is astounding when we listen to the same by keeping it by our Bedside or Coffee Table.  The advantage of this Bluetooth speaker are the following:1. Very Rugged, Handy and cylindrical in size.2. 360 Degree Quality Sound. Not feeling tiresome for hours of listening.3. App Connectivity to control Bass, Treble etc4. 24 Hours Playtime5. Unlike JBL Flip 5 or 6, Tribit Stormbox 2 has call connectivity and mic to listen to incoming calls (handsfree call) and speak using built-in mic.6. One touch Bass ON/OFF Button7. Party mode to connect multiple speakers simultaneouslyI listen to music/audiobooks mostly using this device.
Value for money I have got issue with my headphones and I am using this speaker for my calls and been very efficient all calls quality is awesome.

The media could not be loaded.
                
            
                
            
            
        
    
    








  
  
    ¬†Sound quality excellent üëå fully 360 , Battery üîã backup is also classic.You can think ü§î about it

Tried it in various settings, including X-Bass and all other options on the phone app and at different volume settings too. Also played with the 9-band equalizer applying many of my own settings. Played a few dozen of my favorite songs to try out all these sound settings. My music collection is in .flac.At first I thought the speaker was damaged, that there was a tear in one of the speakers but then in some songs the bass seemed deep and in other songs the treble seemed high, so clearly the speaker itself is not damaged. Mid-range felt a bit screechy to my ear, I couldn't hear all the instruments clearly. It all seemed muffled. The speaker lacks warmth and a natural balanced sound despite whichever sound setting I used.My old Macbook Pros have produced more balanced and clear sound than this although there won't be the deep bass of this speaker. We also have the Redmi Brick at home and I compared playing the same songs on both StomBox 2 and the Redmi Brick, and every time I preferred the sound out of the Redmi Brick.If all you care about is a loud sound with extra bass and treble, the StormBox 2 may work well for you, however, if you're the type who wants to enjoy your music in the quiet and peace of your room or surrounding where there is no other disturbance but only the music you hear, look for some other speaker. I will definitely not recommend this one.
I love this piece of art, salute to artist Thank you.....ü´°

reviewTitle: Good sound and lot of customization
reviewDescription: I had to return the speaker coz i was looking for a speaker to attend meetings. 360 degrees sound was not serving my purpose.However, speaker is really good, loud, good quality. Lot of customization options from the app. Best feature is you can configure it to never switch off while in idle mode.. I was confused between the JBL Flip 5 and this, but it turned out to be really good. The sound quality with X-Bass are impressive. Even at just 50% volume, it fills a medium size room like a lounge. I'm not a heavy user and occasionally go on trips (especially hiking) with friends, so I wanted a speaker that works well both indoors and outdoors. It's been a week since it arrived, and I haven't even charged it yet, despite using it daily for 2+ hours. The biggest advantage for me is its weight (570g) and long-lasting battery. This means I need to charge it less frequently, and the battery health will likely last longer. All of this comes at a lower price than the JBL Flip. P.S I got it for ‚Çπ4.3k during a sale with a card offer.

The product feels slightly overpriced when compared to the Tribit XSound Go i owned prior to this. While this speaker boasts an output of 34 watts‚Äîdouble that of the Tribit XSound Go‚Äîit doesn't feel significantly louder. Additionally, the audio becomes sharp and unpleasant at 100% volume, making it uncomfortable to listen. The sweet spot for optimal sound quality lies between 50-70% volume.On the positive side, the bass is good, and the speaker has a premium build. The audio is crisp and clear at volumes below 70%. However, the Tribit XSound Go manages 100% volume much more efficiently, without sacrificing sound quality.Considering the price and wattage output, I would prefer the Tribit XSound Go over this speaker
